Class StudentLoginController

java.lang.Object
comp3111.examsystem.controller.StudentLoginController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class StudentLoginController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The `StudentLoginController` class manages the student login functionality within the Exam Management System. It handles user authentication by verifying the student's credentials and managing the transition to the main user interface upon successful login.

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the controller. This method is called after the FXML file has been loaded.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
      resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object is not localized.

    • accountExists

      public boolean accountExists(String username)
      Checks if a student account exists based on the provided username.
      Parameters:
      username - The username to check.
      Returns:
      True if the account exists, false otherwise.

    • getStudentByUsername

      public Student getStudentByUsername(String username)
      Retrieves a Student object based on the provided username.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the student to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The Student object if found, or null if not found.

    • checkLogin

      public boolean checkLogin()
      Validates the login credentials of a student.
      Returns:
      True if the login is successful (account exists and password is correct), false otherwise.

    • login

      public void login(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      Handles the login action triggered by the user.
      Parameters:
      e - The action event triggered by the login button.

    • register

      public void register()
      Opens the student registration window.
